questiontext.text:
Below are three implementations of basic Try it! functions with the set-up identical to how TinyMCE Code-Snippet editor + additions make in Java, Python and C. Also has an undefined language. 

public class hello {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
    	String output = "";
        String[] list = new String[] {"T", "h", "i", "s", " ", "r", "a", "n", " ", "J", "a", "v", "a"};
        for (int i = 0; i < 13; i++) {
        	output += list[i];
        }
        System.out.println(output);
    }
}
def some_function():
    alpha_list = ("This", "ran", "Python")
    print(" ".join(alpha_list))
some_function()

#include <stdio.h>
int main() {
	char beta[11] = {'T', 'h', 'i', 's', ' ', 'r', 'a', 'n', ' ', 'C', '\0'};
	printf("%s", beta);
  }

#include <stdio.h>
int main() {
	char beta[11] = {'T', 'h', 'i', 's', ' ', 'r', 'a', 'n', ' ', 'C', '\0'};
	printf("%s", beta);
  }

def this_shouldnt_run():
   print('no'+'no'+'no'+'no')

def this_shouldnt_run():
   print('Oops,' + ' this

#include <stdio.h>
int main() {
	char beta[11] = {'T', 'h', 'i', 's', ' ', 'r', 'a', 'n', ' ', 'C', '\0'};
	printf("%s", beta);
  }
